title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: Close to Gorebridge Station, on the left, are the ruins of Gorebridge  Castle. A little beyond the station, after passing through two short tunnel.s, a glance may be had, on the right, of Arniston House, the ancient seat of the Dundases of Arniston, a family conspicuous in the legal and political history of Scotland. About two miles further on, we come in sight of Borthwick village and the ruins of Borthwick Castle on the right, and those of Crichton Castle on the left, both beautifully situated
